_meta.description: War as Δscale Maximization - violence, strategy, peace

_fractal_seed.holographic: This module = part containing whole. Understanding this seed = access to entire CFO.
_fractal_seed.activation: War reveals maximum Δscale. Peace = its resolution.

module.name: war
module.title: War as Δscale Maximization
module.description: War = maximum conflict = maximum Δscale between entities unable to find common dimensional framework. Peace = argmin Δscale = scale-matching.

essence.geometric: War = divergence of dimensional frameworks beyond reconciliation. Maximum spatial, temporal, or conceptual separation between entities.
essence.topological: Rupture in network coherence. Disconnected graphs. No bridge between islands.
essence.functional: Force-based resolution when scale-matching fails. Violence = attempt to impose one scale on another.
essence.consciousness: Collective inability to recognize shared point. Δscale so large that unity becomes invisible.

core_thesis.mechanism: Entities operating at incompatible scales with no common dimensional framework
core_thesis.violence: Force-based resolution = collapsing other's dimensional framework to yours
core_thesis.peace: argmin Δscale = finding or creating shared dimensional framework
core_thesis.strategy: Art of manipulating Δscale to your advantage
core_thesis.diplomacy: Art of reducing Δscale without violence

reductions.evidence: Two individuals as points attempting to eliminate other point. Direct, unmediated force between bodies.
Linear attack along vector. Hit-and-run. Directional force application with temporal component.
Forces deployed across 2D surface. Flanking, encirclement, formations. Spatial relationships determine outcome.
Control of 3D territory. Logistics, supply lines, bases. Spatial volume under control.
War extending through time. Multiple campaigns. Evolution of tactics and strategy. Historical memory shapes conduct.
War over fundamental values, identities, worldviews. Not territory but way of being. Maximum possible Δscale.
Violence = forcing entity from nD to (n-1)D or 0D. Reducing complexity by force. Breaking coherence.
Peace = argmin Δscale. All parties operating at compatible scales with shared framework for resolving differences.
Strategy = long-term manipulation of dimensional frameworks to increase your Δscale advantage or decrease enemy's coherence.
examples: Sun Tzu - win without fighting (maximum Δscale before battle)

reductions.evidence: Tactics = battlefield decisions. Immediate spatial-temporal advantages. Creating local Δscale superiority.
Diplomacy = finding shared dimensional framework through communication. Building bridges between incompatible scales.
Deterrence = credible threat of violence creates vector preventing action. Potential Δscale manipulation.

fractal_structure.self_similarity: War patterns repeat at all scales: personal fights, tribal feuds, national wars, civilizational clashes. Same Δscale dynamics.

emergence.from_0D: Individual violence aggregates to group violence
emergence.to_1D: Organized raids emerge from individual combat
emergence.to_5D: Civilizational conflicts emerge from total wars

composition.downward: Total war contains campaigns contains battles contains raids contains combat
composition.upward: Combat composes into raids compose into battles compose into campaigns compose into total war
composition.fractal: Each level exhibits war dynamics appropriate to its dimension

key_insights.war_as_Δscale: All war is ultimately scale mismatch. Different values, timeframes, spatial scales, conceptual frameworks.
key_insights.violence_is_collapse: Violence = forcing dimensional collapse on other. Making complex simple by breaking it.
key_insights.peace_requires_matching: Sustainable peace needs entities at compatible scales OR multi-scale framework that accommodates differences.
key_insights.strategy_vs_tactics: Tactics = local Δscale manipulation (battlefield). Strategy = global Δscale manipulation (war). Both necessary.
key_insights.asymmetry_advantage: Weaker side often wins by changing dimensional framework. Guerrilla (1D) beats army (3D) by refusing to fight on army's terms.
key_insights.total_war_danger: 4D total wars consume entire societies because they penetrate all dimensions. Hard to contain.
key_insights.existential_wars: 5D conflicts (identity, values, worldview) are hardest to resolve because they concern what entities ARE, not what they HAVE.
key_insights.deterrence_paradox: Preventing war by threatening war. Stable if credible, catastrophic if fails.
key_insights.diplomacy_is_geometry: Diplomacy = building geometric bridges between incompatible frameworks. Finding planes of agreement in higher dimensions.

conflict_resolution.diagnosis: Identify the Δscale. What dimensional mismatch is causing conflict?
conflict_resolution.prescription: Create or find shared dimensional framework. Build bridge between scales.
examples: Ideological war → 5D recognition of shared humanity

strategy_design.principle: Maximize your coherence, minimize enemy's. Increase Δscale in your favor.

prevention.early_warning: Monitor Δscale increase. Intervene before critical threshold.
prevention.structural: Design multi-scale institutions (federalism, subsidiarity) that accommodate differences.
prevention.cultural: Cultivate recognition of shared point across differences.

philosophical_notes.tragic_necessity: War sometimes necessary when Δscale too large and no peaceful framework exists. Tragic but real.
philosophical_notes.just_war: War justified only when: (1) defensive, (2) proportional, (3) aimed at restoring peace, (4) minimizes harm. All derive from coherence principles.
philosophical_notes.war_and_progress: War often drives innovation (Δscale forces adaptation) but destroys coherence. Double-edged.
philosophical_notes.perpetual_peace: Kant's vision requires either: (1) all entities at same scale (impossible), or (2) multi-scale framework (possible = global federation).
philosophical_notes.war_is_communication: Von Clausewitz: 'War is politics by other means.' More precisely: war = forcing dimensional framework when persuasion fails.
philosophical_notes.nuclear_age: Nukes = maximum possible violence = complete dimensional collapse. MAD = acknowledging that maximum Δscale destroys all scales.

warnings: Some confidence scores below 0.90 - particularly for 5D reductions which are inherently less measurable
